name: AWS SQS server side encryption not enabled
description:
This policy identifies SQS queues that are not enabled with Server Side Encryption (SSE). SSE lets you transmit sensitive data in encrypted queues. SSE protects the contents of messages in Amazon SQS queues using keys managed in the AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS). SSE encrypts messages as soon as Amazon SQS receives them. The messages are stored in encrypted form and Amazon SQS decrypts messages only when they are sent to an authorized consumer.

SQS SSE and the AWS KMS security standards can help you meet encryption-related compliance requirements.
searchModel.query: config from cloud.resource where cloud.type = 'aws' AND api.name = 'aws-sqs-get-queue-attributes' AND json.rule = attributes.KmsMasterKeyId does not exist
recommendation:
1. Log in to the AWS console
2. Select the region, from the region drop-down, in which the alert is generated
3. Navigate to Simple Queue Service (SQS) dashboard
4. Choose the reported Simple Queue Service (SQS) and choose 'Edit'
5. Scroll to the 'Encryption - Optional' section
6. Set the 'Server-side encryption' to 'Enabled', Choose 'Customer master key' and 'Data key reuse period' as per your requirement.
7. Click on 'Save'
